name: Bald Eagle
fact: Bald eagles can see four to seven times farther than humans.
question: What is the wingspan of a bald eagle?

name: Macaw Parrot
fact: Macaws can live up to 80 years in captivity.
question: What makes parrots able to mimic human speech?

name: Emperor Penguin
fact: Emperor penguins can dive deeper than 1,800 feet and hold their breath for over 20 minutes.
question: Where do emperor penguins live?

name: Great Horned Owl
fact: Owls can rotate their heads up to 270 degrees in either direction.
question: Why are owls such effective hunters at night?

name: Hummingbird
fact: Hummingbirds can beat their wings up to 80 times per second.
question: What is unique about hummingbird flight?

name: Flamingo
fact: Flamingos get their pink color from the food they eat.
question: What do flamingos eat?

name: Peacock
fact: A peacock's tail can have up to 200 colorful feathers.
question: Why do male peacocks display their tail feathers?

name: Ostrich
fact: Ostriches are the largest and heaviest birds in the world.
question: How fast can an ostrich run?

name: Toucan
fact: A toucan's colorful bill can be up to half the length of its body!
question: What is the toucan's large bill mainly used for?

name: Pelican
fact: A pelican's pouch can hold up to 3 gallons of water!
question: How do pelicans catch fish?

name: Crow
fact: Crows can recognize human faces and hold grudges for years!
question: What tool-using behavior are crows known for?

name: Kiwi
fact: Kiwis are the only birds with nostrils at the tip of their beak!
question: Can kiwi birds fly?

name: Northern Cardinal
fact: Cardinals are one of the few bird species where both males and females sing!
question: Why are male cardinals bright red?

name: Woodpecker
fact: Woodpeckers can peck up to 20 times per second without getting a headache!
question: How do woodpeckers protect their brain while pecking?

name: Swan
fact: Swans can form lifelong partnerships with their mates.
question: What is a group of swans called?

name: Albatross
fact: Albatrosses can fly for years without landing, sleeping while gliding!
question: What is the wingspan of the wandering albatross?

name: Kingfisher
fact: Japan's bullet train was designed based on the kingfisher's beak shape to reduce noise!
question: How do kingfishers catch fish?

name: American Robin
fact: Robins can hear worms moving underground!
question: What is the robin often considered a sign of?

name: Peregrine Falcon
fact: Peregrine falcons are the fastest animals on Earth, diving at over 240 mph!
question: What is a falcon's hunting dive called?

name: Cockatoo
fact: Cockatoos can live over 70 years and some can dance to music!
question: What is the crest on a cockatoo's head used for?
